review_title: Staff is expendable, no opportunity for growth and inconsistent pay rates.
job_title: Community Support Specialist in Reading, PA
pros: Clients were great. Really enjoyed working the  7 on 7 off shift.  10 Vacation days to start. Great bunch of co-workers. Lots of overtime. Some manages were really great and
cons: You will never be promoted in this company. Many people get fired for "rules" that are inconsistent. Company wants to appear good on paper and they stress the importance of consumers/clients rights, but its a bunch of bull. Consumers/clients rights are never considered when its the company making a decision. Benefits are not that great and pay raises are the minimum and inconsistent, some new hires were starting at pay rates higher than employees who had been with the company 10+ years or more.  The company does not value its employees, you are seen as replaceable and can and will be fired for petty things if they don't like you. They never  take into consideration the  number of years with company, or the care and compassion one provides to the clients.  Its almost as if they would prefer you to not build relationships with the people you care for and the co-workers you spend so much time with.  Managers are sometimes overworked and never last long. Upper management has no clue as to what goes on in the houses they show up once a year for inspections.
